data.overview: Fortinet posted a strong Q2 with total billings growth of 15% and revenue growth of 14%, outperforming billings and operating margin guidance and delivering a non‑GAAP operating margin of 33.1%. Key commercial KPIs showed continued enterprise momentum: deals >$1M increased 29% with dollar value up 51%, total RPO grew 12% to $6.64 billion (current RPO +15% to $3.45 billion), Unified SASE ARR was $1.15 billion (+22%) and SecOps ARR was $463 million (+35%), while FortiSASE ARR grew over 100% with a 65% expansion in its customer base. Gross margin improved to 81.6% (product gross margin 67.8%, service gross margin 87.8%), adjusted free cash flow in Q2 was $428 million (YTD adjusted FCF $1.27 billion, 40% margin), and the company repurchased ~4.6 million shares for $401 million (remaining buyback ~$1.6 billion). Management emphasized that FortiSASE complements rather than cannibalizes firewall sales, noted they are ~40%–50% through the 2026 firewall refresh cycle, highlighted strong OT (>20%) and sovereign SASE momentum, and reiterated large strategic infrastructure investments to support Unified SASE and cloud services; they also said they raised the full‑year billings midpoint and adjusted the revenue mix from services to product while maintaining total revenue guidance and nudging up the operating margin midpoint.
